Tiga Pasar Tradisional di Sragen Jadi Percobaan Pembayaran Retribusi Online
02 Nov 2019, 15:26 by Mulato Isha'an


Tiga Pasar Tradisional di Sragen Jadi Percobaan Pembayaran Retribusi Online

KBRN, Sragen: Dinas Perindustrian dan Perdagangan (Disperindag) Kabupaten Sragen akan menerapkan pembayaran retribusi online dengan model e-Tikecting. Langkah ini sebagai cara transisi dari penarikan retribusi konvensional ke e-Retribusi. Pembayaran retribusi yang dimulai 2020 belum sepenuhnya non tunai, karena masih ada petugas yang keliling menarik retribusi seperti biasa. Kepala Bidang (Kabid) Pengelolaan Pasar Disperindag Widya Budi mengatakan, tiga pasar akan menjadi percontohan dalam pembayaran retribusi e-Tikecting ini, yakni pasar Sumberlawang, Pasar Gondang dan Pasar Gemolong. "Penerapan kebijakan ini tindak lanjut dari evaluasi pelaksanaan e-retribusi di Pasar Kota dan Pasar Bunder yang tidak optimal," katanya Sabtu (2/11/2019).Oleh sebab itu e-Tikecting menjadi trobosan untuk transisi pasar yang belum menjalankan e-Retribusi, dengan konsep masih menggunakan kartu, hanya saja pedagang bisa membayar secara tunai. Lantas program e-Tikecting ini diberlakukan di pasar-pasar kecamatan yang belum terakses bank mitra yang ditunjuk mengurusi retribusi. "Seperti di Jenar, Gesi Tangen kan bank mitra kita belum sampai sana," ujarnya.Dia menyampaikan, pedagang nantinya akan dibekali kartu sebagai identitas pemilik los dan kios yang berfungsi untuk membayar. Dengan retribusi sistem e Tikecting maka retribusi yang dibayarkan pedagang akan langsung masuk ke rekening kas daerah sehingga tidak akan bocor.”Ini langkah awal mengurangi kertas retribusi, kadang satu transaksi bisa melebihi satu sobekan. Tidak efektif, dengan ini lebih efektif,” ungkapnya.Sementara itu, Kepala Disperindag Tedy Rosanto menyampaikan saat ini ada kendala untuk pelaksanaan E-Retribusi di sejumlah pasar. Pihaknya menyampaikan untuk sistem E-Retribusi memang benar-benar non tunai, pedagang harus mengisi ulang kartu dengan saldo untuk membayar. "Karena pedagang yang tidak semuanya paham teknologi, ditambah malas biasanya hanya nitip ke petugas pasar. Jadinya malah menambah pekerjaan petugas. Belum lagi terkendala infrastruktur dan jaringan," jelas Tedy.

Three Traditional Markets in Sragen Become Online Trial Payment Levies
02 Nov 2019, 15:26 by Mulato Isha'an


Three Traditional Markets in Sragen Become Online Trial Payment Levies

KBRN, Sragen: The Department of Industry and Trade (Disperindag) of Sragen Regency will implement an online levy payment using the e-Tikecting model. This step is a way of transitioning from the withdrawal of conventional levies to e-Retribution. Payment of levies that began in 2020 is not yet fully non-cash, because there are still officers who go around collecting fees as usual. The Head of the Disperindag Market Management Head (Kabid), Widya Budi, said that the three markets will become a model for e-Tikecting levy payments, namely Sumberlawang market, Gondang Market and Gemolong Market. "The application of this policy is a follow-up of the evaluation of the implementation of e-retribution in the City Market and the Bunder Market that is not optimal," he said Saturday (11/02/2019). Therefore e-Tikecting became a breakthrough for the market transition that has not run e-Retribution , with the concept of still using a card, it's just that traders can pay in cash. Then the e-Tikecting program is implemented in sub-district markets that have not yet been accessed by a designated partner bank to handle fees. "Like in Jenar, Gesi Tangen, our partner bank hasn't arrived yet," he said. He said that traders will be provided with a card as the identity of the owner of the stall and kiosk that serves to pay. With the e-Tikecting system levy, the fees paid by traders will go directly to the regional treasury account so that they will not leak. ”This is the first step in reducing paper levies, sometimes one transaction can exceed one tear. It is not effective, with this it is more effective, "he said. Meanwhile, Head of the Department of Industry and Trade Tedy Rosanto said that currently there are obstacles to the implementation of E-Retribution in a number of markets. He said that for the E-Retribution system it is truly non-cash, the merchant must refill the card with a balance to pay. "Because traders who do not all understand technology, are lazy and usually only send money to market officials. So, it actually adds to the work of officers. Not to mention constrained by infrastructure and networks," said Tedy.
